name: Disaining
details: On top of being one of the best Canon cameras for photography, it's also a very capable video camera. It records 1080p and oversampled 4k video at up to 60 fps and delivers high-quality video, which looks good even in low light. Its autofocus performs consistently in either resolution.

name: Planing
details: The most significant control difference is the redesigned power switch that starts the R5C as either a photo camera or a video camera.

name: Profesonal-drawing
details: Next for the actual video quality and I’ll start with a look through the menus.

name: Laboratory-testing
details: The core specification of any super-zoom camera is of course the lens, and with the SX70 HS, Canon’s chosen to stick with the same optics introduced on its predecessor.

name: Risk-strategy
details: The payback for that extra bulk is a built-in electronic viewfinder and a versatile fold-out screen – which I’ll talk more about next.

name: Site-inspection
details: I found it a big advantage for framing wildlife and other subjects when zoomed in. There’s also now a sensor to automatically toggle between the screen and the viewfinder when you put your eye to it.
